en: The Buddha teaches the Dharma perfectly.
translation: The Blessed One taught the Dharma well.

en: And when one performs terrific activities, it is the reverse of the above.
translation: In the case of forceful activity, the reverse is the case.

en: Since the truth of the path is the supreme means of liberation, holding a discipline and ritual to be paramount, will not develop.
translation: Since it is the supreme means of liberation, clinging to it as paramount does not increase clinging to discipline and ritual as paramount.

en: And the knowing mind is also a state of infinite, all-embracing, space-like evenness.
translation: The mind that understands this is like this: it is an expansive openness, like space.

en: He replied, “This is owing to the non-apprehension of desire!”
translation: He replied, “This is owing to the non-apprehension of desire!”

en: 26.And by their merest wish, these pure, enlightened ones Can show the galaxies that fill the whole of space Within a single mote of dust, and show a mote as great as all the universe— Without the dust enlarging or the universe contracting.
translation: 26.The pure ones who follow this approach show that a single particle is located in space and that it pervades all directions, but the particle does not become coarse and the world does not become subtle.

en: Then, muttering " Vajrasattva"', one imagines in back of Vairocana a sun halo; and muttering " Vajrasattva samayas tvam aham" , one brings about the 'pride' in oneself that oneself and the Knowledge Being are non dual.
translation: Then, with “vajrasattva” imagine a sun-disk back behind Vairocana, and with “vajrasattva samayastvaṃ āhoṃ” imagine yourself as the embodiment of nondual timeless awareness and pride.

en: With this view you should realize the three worlds as pure.
translation: Cause this intention to purify the three planes of existence!

en: If you can’t manage that much, then generate the Principal Mother together with the four heart yoginis from the short A and YA, RA, LA, and WA and the thirty-two dakinis from the three-OM mantra.
translation: If you cannot do that much, then the Principal Mother and the four heart yoginis transform into the short A and YA, RA, LA, and VAM.

en: This general term for the holy Dharma has been separately applied and thus surely this teaching has assumed the particular moniker Pacification of Suffering.
translation: In other words, having given the general name of the sacred Dharma in general and given the particular name of what is dear to them, the Dharma that pacifies suffering is the Dharma.

en: You should approach your short-term and long-term goals by praying to the Three Jewels and not by relying upon the ordinary mo diviners, Bon priests and so forth.
translation: You should do all your immediate and long-term aims by praying to the Three Jewels, but not by relying on ordinary diviners and Bönpos and so forth.

en: Do not discuss others' faults, but expose your own hidden flaws.
translation: Do not speak of others’ faults, but expose your own hidden faults.

en: Train in the three general points.
translation: Train in the three general points.

en: Manifesting here and now as a noble holder of the vows,
translation: Now, in the guise of a sublime observer of vows,

en: We also are able to recognize that we do not control all aspects of any situation.
translation: We also realize that we cannot control all the aspects of a situation.

en: Then you do the five empowerments for the awareness, the sixth being that of the Vajra Master.
translation: Next, there are the five knowledge empowerments, the vajra master, and the final support of the empowerment.

en: This verse reveals that fools have no good qualities that benefit themselves or others, and they have every sort of fault and shortcoming that is harmful. So wherever they go in any direction, everyone avoids honoring them and shun them.
translation: Fools do not have good qualities that benefit themselves or others and are full of all the faults of harm. So wherever they go they will refrain from respecting all people and avoiding them.

en: Read not to contradict and confute, nor to believe and take for granted, nor to find talk and discourse, but to weigh and consider.
translation: When you read, you should not refute or refute the reader, and you should not apprehend all the words as true.

en: Regarding valid means of knowledge, there is only direct perception; inference that engages with hidden objects does not apprehend the actual thing, and so it does not fulfill the criteria for valid knowledge.
translation: Regarding valid cognition, apart from direct perception alone, inference that engages with hidden objects does not apprehend the actual object, so the definition of valid cognition is incomplete.

en: This style of synthesis consists of the tradition found in The Compendium of the Great Way; other texts present it otherwise.
translation: This method of the Compendium of Principles is the system of the Compendium of Abhidharma, and there are other explanations elsewhere.
